009package imagingbook.spectral.dct;
010
011import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
012import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
013
014public class DctMatrixTest {
015
016
017        /**
018         * Test method.
019         * @param args command arguments
020         */
021        public static void main(String[] args) {
022                PrintPrecision.set(5);
023                float[][] A = makeDctMatrix(4, 4);
024                System.out.println("A = " + Matrix.toString(A));
025                System.out.println();
026
027                float[][] At = Matrix.transpose(A);
028                System.out.println("At = " + Matrix.toString(At));
029                System.out.println();
030                
031                float[][] g = {
032                                {1,2,3,4},
033                                {7,2,0,9},
034                                {6,5,2,5},
035                                {0,9,8,1}};
036                
037                System.out.println("---------- original 2D signal -----------");
038                System.out.println("g = " + Matrix.toString(g));
039                System.out.println();
040                
041                
042                System.out.println("---------- DCT with transformation methods -----------");
043                
044                float[][] G1 = Matrix.duplicate(g);
045                Dct2d.Float dct = new Dct2d.Float();
046                dct.forward(G1);
047                System.out.println("G1 = " + Matrix.toString(G1));
048                System.out.println();
049                
050                // inverse  DFT with transformation methods
051                float[][] g1r = Matrix.duplicate(G1);
052                dct.inverse(g1r);
053                System.out.println("g1r = " + Matrix.toString(g1r));
054                
055                System.out.println();
056                System.out.println("---------- DCT by matrix multiplication -----------");
057                
058                float[][] g2 = Matrix.duplicate(g);
059                float[][] G2 = Matrix.multiply(A, Matrix.multiply(g2, At));
060                System.out.println("G2 = " + Matrix.toString(G2));
061                System.out.println();
062                
063                float[][] g2r = Matrix.multiply(At, Matrix.multiply(G2, A));
064                System.out.println("g2r = " + Matrix.toString(g2r));
065                
066//              float[][] I1 = Matrix.multiply(At, A);
067//              System.out.println("I1 = " + Matrix.toString(I1));
068//              
069//              float[][] I2 = Matrix.multiply(A, At);
070//              System.out.println("I2 = " + Matrix.toString(I2));
071        }
072        
073        static float[][] makeDctMatrix(int M, int N) {
074                float[][] A = new float[M][N];
075                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
076                        double c_i = (i == 0) ? 1.0 / Math.sqrt(2) : 1;
077                        for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {
078                                A[i][j] = (float)
079//                                              \sqrt{\tfrac{2}{N}} \cdot c_i \cdot 
080//                                              \cos\Bigl(\frac{\pi \cdot (2j + 1) \cdot i}{2M}\Bigr) ,
081                                        (Math.sqrt(2.0/N) * c_i * Math.cos(Math.PI * (2*j + 1) * i / (2.0 * M)) );
082                        }
083                }
084                
085                return A;
086        }
087
088}
